State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: Identified and published by Stein as "1 coin AR of Constans (337-350 AD); see Pl. CXL, no.13". Re-identified in 1990s by Roman coin specialists at the British Museum as entered on this record (type: RIC 18).
Bibliographic references: Stein 1921a / Serindia: detailed report of archaeological explorations in Central Asia and Westernmost China (p. 1340, pl.CXL, no. 13)
Wang 2004 / Money on the Silk Road: the evidence from Eastern Central Asia to c. AD 800 (p.153)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Constantius II
Acquisition notes: Registration nos beginning S refer to coins acquired on Stein's Second Central Asian Expedition, and published in his book Serindia.
